    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Graph()
      Constructs a vertex indexed 0 with no name and puts it in graph.
      Graph(Vertex[] vertices)
      Constructs a graph from array of vertices.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Graph

        public Graph()
        Constructs a vertex indexed 0 with no name and puts it in graph.

      • Graph

        public Graph(Vertex[] vertices)
        Constructs a graph from array of vertices. For example: vertices = {0, 1, 2, 3} gives a graph that has vertices of index 0, 1, 2, 3. Their names can be added separately using class Vertex methods.
        Parameters:
        vertices - Array of vertices from which to construct a graph from

    • Method Detail

      • setAdjacentVertex

        public void setAdjacentVertex(int indexOfActiveVertex,
                              int indexOfneighbour)
        Set method that adds index 'indexOfNeighbour' to adjacency list of vertex indexed as 'indexOfActiveVertex'.
        Parameters:
        indexOfActiveVertex - Index of vertex to which we add adjacent vertex
        indexOfneighbour - Index of vertex is going to be added as adjacent to indexOfActiveVertex

      • insertAdjacentVertices

        public void insertAdjacentVertices()
        Method that prompts the user to insert adjacent vertices.

      • isConnected

        public boolean isConnected(int vertex,
                           int finish)
        Checks if two vertices are connected. Calls BFSstopOnFinish
        Parameters:
        vertex - index of source vertex
        finish - index of destination vertex
        Returns:
        true if a is connected to b, false if not

      • DFSfull

        public void DFSfull(int vertex)
        Performs a full DFS traversal. Starts DFS from 'vertex', but also from all other vertices that were not visited from the original call.
        Parameters:
        vertex - index of vertex form which to start BFS

      • DFSstart

        public void DFSstart(int vertex)
        Starts a DFS traversal from 'vertex'. If you want to be sure to traverse the whole graph, use DFSfull instead.
        Parameters:
        vertex - index of vertex form which to start DFS

      • BFSstart

        public void BFSstart(int vertex)
        Starts a BFS traversal from 'vertex'. If you want to be sure to traverse the whole graph, use BFSfull instead.
        Parameters:
        vertex - index of vertex form which to start BFS

      • BFSfull

        public void BFSfull(int vertex)
        Performs a full BFS traversal. Starts BFS from 'vertex', but also from all other vertices that were not visited from the original call.
        Parameters:
        vertex - index of vertex form which to start BFS
